question: Why soaps do not work in hard water?
option1: The water tastes bitter and it has an unpleasant smell
option2: The water is hard to boil and the soap only works in boiled water
option3: The insoluble soaps formed separate as scum in water
option4: The hard water has lot of impurities
answer: The insoluble soaps formed separate as scum in water
explanation: Hard water contains calcium and magnesium ions. These ions form insoluble calcium and magnesium soaps respectively when sodium or potassium soaps are dissolved in hard water. These insoluble soaps separate as scum in water and are useless as cleansing agent.
